review: This is my family's favorite burger place. When we go, we always have great time and the food is of quality. I have eaten at Red Robin's all over the country and the one here in Brandon is  solid on presentation and taste. The fries were fresh and hot and the burgers were cooked close to perfect.  As with all restaurants,  service is what determines most ratings. In the case of Red Robin, the only critique I can offer the Brandon location is....if you stay open until a certain time make sure you  willing to give the best service until that final customer leaves.  Overall is was a good experience and I will be coming back

I can say I will not be back at this place. Kevin was our waiter n he was bad. Took forever to take our order forever to bring our drinks. And the way he spoke to us we couldn't understand one word. He needs to pickup his jeans I don't need to see his underwear  We asked for more fries n never got them n no refills on our drinks  I will not be going back

Really great burgers but their rewards system is so frustrating. First lost sll.of our points a few years agonwhen they changed programs and then they accidently used our free burger we earned on a $6 bill even though we asked them not to. They told us it was fixed and would be there when we come back in. Low and behold, surprise surprise, it wasn't there. Managers just shrug their shoulders and say there is nothing they can do. Very frustrating.

Quick sum-up of our experience: -Below average food, generally lower quality than other restaurants and not up to the standard that Red Robin usually provides at other locations -Average service and speed (there was a "glitch" with our order in the system and it took a while to get ours but others seemed to get their food when you would expect) -Slight smell (wife described it as "barf smelling") throughout the restaurant Overall the place was not what we had expected it to be. When we arrived at the restaurant we had to wait a few minutes to be seated as the host(ess) was not at the host(ess) podium but were seated immediately after they arrived. When we entered the restaurant my wife immediately could smell something unpleasant (she described it as "barf smelling") and persisted throughout the restaurant. Our waitress was not the friendliest and due to an issue with our order we had to wait about 30 minutes to get our main course. We did however, order the chips and guacamole appetizer and it was pretty good. We will probably give this place another try as it's so close to our place, generally like Red Robin, and know that everyone, no matter what industry your in, is bound to have a bad day here and there.

I wish I could give them no stars! Food was horrible !! It wasn't even packed how do you serve cold food ?! Along with a refill in a dirty glass . We were only checked on when we were ready for our check how's that for service . Surely won't be going back . Everyone save your money and the hassle of leaving annoyed and still Hungry

We always have a great time when we visit this location. We have a child with an egg allergy and he has been able to eat here safely MANY times. Some of his favorites are mac and cheese (bottomless), grilled cheese, and grilled chicken with mandarin oranges (his favorite bottomless side). My husband and I enjoy ordering the tavern burgers to leave space for the yummy bottomless sides. We start with a side of broccoli and then our next side is fries (it's all about balance right?). Our son enjoys the balloon on the way out the door (our family rule is you get a balloon if you are good for the meal ;-)

Burgers are always amazing and nice variety of different tastes.  Bottomless fries and certain specialty drinks,  like the strawberry lemonade,  is a nice bonus.  Can't leave this place still hungry.  Wait staff is usually kind and on point.  4 star due to cleanliness.  It's a big restraunt and can get busy at times,  but they could do a better job cleaning the tables between guests.

Here's a few questions I asked myself several times.  1.) Where is my server? 2.) Why is my glass empty? 3.) Why is this grilled chicken crunchy in the middle? 4.) if my fries are bottomless, why have I only been served one helping. I asked for soft, hot broccoli and it was almost raw and barely warm.. sad visit. I usually love Red Robin. I gave it one star because the hostess was nice.

I was planning to have dinner at another burger place but when my friend called me to see if I wanted to meet up, we chose Red Robin because of their Tavern Burger promotion to get 2 burgers with either and appetizer or dessert for $15. I mean the burgers at Red Robin are usually $9-10 a piece so this seemed like a good deal. Plus who doesn't love the bottomless fries?!  Little did we know the menu recently changed and the burgers we were used to were classified as Gourmet Burgers and were not included in the promotion. They have created a set of 5 Tavern Burgers that are variations of a small cheeseburger. So that was disappointing to discover but we were already at the restaurant so we decided to stay.  We placed our order for food and the wait was a bit ridiculous for a place that specializes in one type of cuisine. Burgers and fries should always be ready to go especially with the restaurant being as full as it was during my visit. It took more than 20 minutes for our food to be delivered and then when it was the burgers were luke warm.  The fries were hot and apparently was the holdup causing our burgers to have to sit in the window and get cold.  Aside from the timing, the burgers just were not very good and not what I expected based on my previous visits to this chain. The patties on the tavern burger are the size of a McDonald's cheeseburger, much smaller than I anticipated for a "gourmet burger" restaurant. I ordered the Turbo-q burger which was topped with grilled onions, a spicy sauce and pepper jack cheese with a piece of lettuce. I thought all burgers came with lettuce and tomato but apparently that was a revision I missed as well. It was ok but not a burger I would order again. My friend ordered the Fiery Ghost it was topped with pepper jack cheese, a spicy sauce and raw sliced jalapeños. She was not every excited about her burger either.  For dessert we tried the doughnuts which our server said were so good. I disagree. The doughnuts are fried biscuits and they are not sweet enough for me even with the sugar sprinkle and duo of sauces which accompanied dish. They are ok but not the best versions of fried doughnuts that I have had at local restaurants.  Needless to say we won't be in a rush to go back any time soon. I was actually wishing I had gone to Five Guys like I originally planned. The service and the food quality would have been better.

Have eaten here several times in 2017 and found the service among the best anywhere. Burgers are just awesome! And they have my favorite beer...Not Your Fathers RB. Last night we were in town and went to RR at the Mall. We had a problem with paying our check at the table and the night manager Victoria came over. We couldn't figure out what happened, so Victoria gave us the balance of our meal and covered the tip for our server. Wow...that was very cool.  Later that evening we discovered it was OUR error in the card we used. We called Victoria to pay the balance of the check and she declined our offer/request to pay.  That's some pretty incredible customer service... not to mention generosity and goodwill.  We highly recommend Red Robin at the Mall!

Hostesses were amazingly accommodating because our son has autism! They put us in an area away from babies due to his sensitivity to crying. Our waiter was nice but seemed to just be doing the enough to get it done. We had to ask for refills for half of our party three times because he was forgetting. The knives were dirty that were placed for us. I got my own to go cup as I was leaving liked I worked there. I felt like I wasn't his priority and he snapped at my mom when she asked a question! My food was fined. My son didn't like their burgers. The covered chili cheese fries are to die for!!!
I ordered a Caesar salad. Wasn't that great. They drowned the lettuce in dressing. The chicken was extremely tough. It was the worst salad I've ever had.  I don't think I'd eat there again.

This is my second visit to the Brandon location and my best visit yet.  Our wait time was about 20 minutes and what I love is that they text you when your table is ready so you are free to roam the mall or go next door to Brass Tap and have a drink.  They are always busy due to being at a mall but both visits my wait time was about 20 minutes.  Our waitress was amazing, we didn't have to ask once for refills on drinks or our fries.  Refills on fries you may ask?  Red Robin offers with most of their meals bottomless fries.  I haven't eaten a burger there thay I have disliked but I do tend to get most of the time the Bleu Ribbon burger which is one of their signature burgers. I wish they would give more fries with your meal so that you don't have to ask for more.  When this establishment first came to the area you used to get a decent amount and now the portions are smaller - I find that myself and others usually have to request 1 more refill on fries to be satisfied.  This visit we would get another refill quickly, but in previous visits it would take a while and the portions would still be small.  They have a full bar, other variety of items on the menu other than burgers (but seriously - you should be getting a burger!) and milkshakes and malts.  If you have any room for desert - their chocolate malts are delicious!  If you are looking at the price and thinking to yourself $10 for a burger, remember that most drive throughs you pay on average $7-8 for the meal.  For a couple dollars more you have a freshly made meal and a burger 10x better and bottomless fries.  Red Robbin also offers a rewards, after 9 visits you get your next burger free and on your birthday month you get a free burger (which I used this visit).  This place is great for anyone - a date night, kids birthday or just out with family and friends.  If you're craving for a good burger - this is the place to go!

This is in Brandon Mall  and it is just keeps going down hill every time we try this place. It is not real clean , un-bussed tables and seems to be under staffed every time we come. The server Derek was ok  but it is  not good enough to make up for the rest of the issues. There is a big line and a long wait but there are cleans tables and ones that are not , not sure what the wait is. For the food is was ok nothing great but is was ok. All in all there was a lot of issues from the time we sat to even trying to pay our bill. I will say my normal line ... maybe it was a just off day for them and this is not the norm.

The service here has gone down since they first opened. Service was super slow, we were at the table over 10 minutes before our order was taken. During our meal our drinks were only refilled once, needless to say we probably won't visit this location again. From getting food ordered, refills, to-go boxes and getting the check this location runs on slow motion. Food also wasn't as good as our last visit!

Food was cold hamburger bun was so hard that it literally started to fall apart the moment I picked it up in attempt to take a bite and when I informed the waitress she Informed me and my wife that this matter has been happening very often which is very shocking to me if you are trying to run a very successful business you might want to insure that your food is great also and to make matters worst the manager was Informed and she didn't seem like she even cared like it was just a normal thing I would never recommend this restaurant just a waste of money your better off going to McDonald's

After waiting for 45 minutes I sat and ordered a soft drink. .The waitress took awhile so I was ready to order my food. I ordered the bourbon  burger. She never asked how I would like it.  The food took a long time I hadn't seen the waitress for 15 minutes.  Finally she brought the food out. OMG the burger was greasy and burnt. No tomatoes. The fries were good. But since she gave me my food like haven't seen her again.  No drink refills no water no nothing.  I asked a different waitress for the check and another for a take out tray. And the bottomless fries, forget it if you can get a waitress good luck. The food and Service was the worst. I'll go to Mc D's  next time. The only reason I went there is I had my granddaughters out to get school supplies .
Check in person kept ignoring us and kept checking in people that arrived after us. Felt treated very badly, so we left.

Last three times we've gone here we experienced bad service.  Last night our server took almost ten minutes (with only one other table seated in our area) our drink orders brought out took our appetizer order and then brought out the apps.  Forgot the ranch and mustard.  No Napkins or silverware still.  My wife ordered her sandwich open faced, which apparently is difficult as it came out wrong twice(she just ate it as is the second time)  I then had to ASK for napkins and silverware.  My burger also didn't come with the extra I had ordered on the side.  I asked for my fries with no salt, received garlic butter fries.   The times before this the servers that we've gotten have been slow.  I've been to many Red Robins in a couple of different cities, and we like the food.  It will be a long time before we step foot in this Red Robin again, we'll take our business elsewhere.  Sorry three strikes your out.

While working up a hunger doing some mall walking, we stopped in at Red Robin to fill our reserves. This review is based on food, service, cleanliness, atmosphere, and value.  We were the first ones there , so we were seated fast.  The dining area was clean, and service was good.  As with all Red Robins, the decor is nice.  It's not real flashy or modern, but nice.  We ordered the Reds Tavern Fries.  It took a while, and our server told us they burnt the first batch, so they were making us a fresh batch.  I'm glad they didn't serve us burnt fries.  The fries were good, but didn't have much toppings, a disappointing amount of toppings.  Only about 10% were the Reds Tavern Fries, three rest were just... fries.  For the price, I expected better.  I ordered the Wedgie Burger.  Red Robin advertises "gourmet burgers", but I'm not a fan.  Their patties just don't taste fresh to me.  The Wedgie Burger was less than okay.  I wouldn't order it again.  Like all burgers from every Red Robin location I've ever been to, the patty was dry and tasteless.  They taste like the dry, frozen patties you can get by the case of 40 at nearly any grocery store for $25. I don't know how Red Robin keeps getting me to walk through their doors.  Overall, subpar food at gourmet prices.  I feel bad writing this, because I like the atmosphere and service, but I'm leaving this review as a reminder to myself to never go back.  I just don't like Red Robin.

This location is a pain to go to on weekends because mall gets super packed after 2pm. Its located in Brandon town center mall.  So parking is a hassle to find.  I was there yesterday and the 40 min wait to be seated with my family. Then our food took more than an hour too come out. When it finally came the food was ice cold so everything was rushed to be remade.  The service was horrible. No one even came by to apologize from the management team either.  When this location first opened it was top notch. But now service has went down tremendously.

This Red Robin is located in the Brandon Westfield Mall. Enjoyable atmosphere, a little different than your typical Red Robin, in that the lighting is dimmer, which makes it more intimate. iPads are fixed on the tables, which allow you to not only see the menu options to order, but also to sign up or add/check your club rewards. You also can send an alert to your server if you need anything in between her/his visits while attending to your order. If you belong to the rewards program, one of the perks is a free hamburger on your birthday, but I'm not sure if the free burger is a plain, stripped down burger, or one of their specialty burgers. It's free to join, however. Although I enjoyed my Marco Polo grilled chicken sandwich ($12.99) and freckled strawberry lemonade ($4.49), and my daughter enjoyed her Southern Charm burger ($13.99), fries and freckled strawberry lemonade ($4.49), the lemonade tasted too overly sour, even with the sweetened strawberries in it. Although my daughter said her burger was really good, my Marco Polo chicken sandwich wasn't the knock-your-socks-off type. I've had much better for less money. In fact, I was slightly irritated when I received the check for our lunch. The total lunch bill was $48.00. It also minorly bothered me that there was an additional charge for MY order, because I switched out French fries for onion rings. I wasn't advised there would be an up-charge of $1.49 to change the fries out when I ordered lunch. I think that is something that should always be pointed out during the ordering process. We ordered directly with our waitress, Justine, instead of through the iPad. When I ordered, I do remember asking her if I could replace the French fries with onion rings and she said, "Sure", but that's when your server should tell you there's an additional charge to do so, if that is their policy. Not a large amount of $, but it's the principle of the matter. Service otherwise was cordial and friendly, although I had to ask for a second (endless lemonade) refill. I've been to a lot of Red Robin restaurants over the years, but I don't remember a lunch for two people ever being in the $50 range there. That's one expensive burger and chicken sandwich. To justify that price, it would've had to have been excellent, and that, it just was not.

Didn't expect much coming here based on the reviews but wanted to give it a Try. I ordered the burn'n love burger and fries. You have the option of pink or no pink. Service was a little iffy. Took the server a while to finally take my order and than a few People that seated after me were served their food before me. When I did receive my food the fries were a little cold. Guess it sat for a while. Burger was pretty decent though.

Great service - had a very happy, smiley server who had good advice on the menu when I asked for it. Delicious burgers.... flavor was incredible and perfectly cooked. Atmosphere was very nice and calm. Will go back often!
You know how they spout endless fries??? Lol... that's because with you order you get 4.5 fries then you tell them you want more...& they come when you are ready for the check... sad...

This was one of the worst Red Robin locations we have been to. We saw our waitress three times: drinks, orders, food drop. We never got refills on drinks, and had to flag her down to get more fries. We pushed the call button on the pad and NO one else stopped to help-- the manager and several other wait staff walked circles around us, yet never bothered to check on us/the blinking light. EIGHT minutes we sat there with the light blinking, trying to get anyone's attention. Oh, the food? Order was semi-right (they forgot to put mac 'n cheese on the mac 'n cheese burger, ordered a single, got a double) and a couple burgers were nearly red they were so pink...when asked for well. The buns crumbled, the fries were lukewarm, and the fried pickles were extremely greasy. Will NOT be back.

I usually don't write bad reviews, but when I see bad customer service especially from the management, people need to be advised before eating here. First off the burgers are actually not bad, the fries are bland like always, but that is what you would expect for unlimited fries. The customer service is something that could be worked on. The servers are slow and not as friendly as other Red Robins I have been to. There was an issue of a coupon we received through email from red robins that could only be used for today. It was a buy a gourmet burger and get one 50% off. This was a great deal and instead of going to the food court my friend and I decided to dine in and split the check since I was not going to eat two burgers in one sitting.  We split the burgers and it was time to pay. We told the server before hand that we were doing the deal but when we pressed the pay option on the electronic device which was not explained to us, the split option charged us the full price for both burgers. After trying to track down the server and explaining to them again about the coupon, he took the device and came back shortly with the coupon inputted so the total price was lower. However we tried choosing the split the bill option and it did the same thing again where it charged us the full price. We tried tracking down the server yet again to explain that we would want to split   the bill, he tried looking at the device again and said sorry one of you guys would have to pay the whole bill to receive the coupon. After examining the coupon on the email it never mentioned that one person would have to pay the whole meal or there were any restrictions. My other friend received the email as well but it didn't matter. We wanted to talk to a manager if possible we asked the server. The server replied " Are you sure?  We replied yes. he replied "He is just going to say the same thing I told you." Then again we said please get the manager. The Manager came by, didn't apologize and said one of you guys would have to take the bill or pay separate for full amount. The device wont let us split the bill. I do not know if this is a Red Robin policy that managers of the store are not able to override the device and split the bill, but this put us in a awkward situation. We both had cards, we both wanted to split the bill and we only choose Red Robin because of the coupon deal. He didn't give us any coupons or discounts when we split the bill and paid full price.  Moral of the story is don't visit Brandon's mall Red Robins with coupons. Hope that the check device works for you when you split a bill and don't count on management or servers to fix the problem. Good burgers/ Bad service.

I love Red Robin back in Cali, we moved to Fl last year and i wanted there . This Red Robin was the one closest to us. We came on a Saturday, we didn't know it was inside the mall. We waited more than an hour to get a table, Then when they finally called us , They took about 30 to sit is down,The customer service was not good,, i would definitely not go back to this location ever again,

I just had a dinner tonight for the very first time at this place with my boyfriend. Let me tell you, they have the most incredible drinks (cocktails) that I've had so far!!!!! Good service!!! Amazing! Never want to go anywhere else again. And food is delicious, their burgers worth every single penny. Don't forget to try their donuts for a dessert, you'll absolutely love it. Overall 5 stars from me!

Went for a late weekday lunch. Walked into a screaming child. Absolutely no parental action. Complained to waiter requesting he pass my complaint on to the manager. Requested to see manager and finally was told it was the managers first day. After 30 - 35 mins there was no way I could relax to enjoy my meal. Absolutely terrible managements response.

So I consider myself a Sunday Morning regular so far in 2017. I love this place and location conveniently at the Brandon mall, the service is amazing ESP the bar tender. Very attentive, friendly and fast. Burgers/sandwiches are stellar and combine all of this with bottomless fries!?!? You have a recipe for enjoyment  will definitely be returning weekly.

First time to this Red Robin location. The service was extremely slow.  From taking our initial order, to asking if we wanted or needed anything else.  No small were offered with our appetizer.  The boys ordered root beer floats, which were half foam and when ordered waters after they drank the floats, it took a little over 5 minutes to get it.  Our server, walked around the corner, saw us, remembered the water order and went back to get it.  When she returned, she excused the tardiness, by saying she smashed her finger.  I asked to pay on the table and she was helpful with that.  Can't say that I would recommend this location
Burger, fries, and a spicy Bloodymarry!everything was fresh and great tasting! Busy on a Sunday afternoon!
Great service. I've never had fries quite like these, really tasty. Best Mac and Cheese I've had! Lemonade with passion fruit: Just too good. Very reasonable prices.

Normally I love Red Robin. Had the worst experience at this location and won't be going back to the franchise again. Started when the hostess sat us at a table between the kitchen and the wait station, where servers were waking back and forth on both sides. Got up to move and the incompetent manager just stood there and watched. Tried to sit in the bar and was told that of the 80% empty tables, we were going to have to wait for a server to seat us. Whole time incompetent manager on duty just watched and did nothing. Left and won't be going back.

I used to love Red Robin. I tried to go weekly - homemade "cherry" Coke, burgers, bottomless fries, desserts, and great service.  I'm not sure if Red Robin has gone to crap everywhere, or if it's just Brandon.  I do know this: 2 visits (lunch), 2 lousy lunches, 2 crappy customer service experiences, and 2 eye-opening bills.  There is zero way a burger, fries, and Coke should cost $20 with tax.  There will be no third visit, Brandon Red Robin!
Experience was absolute crap. We came in and ordered food took forever even though the place was coming off the dinner rush. Ford was not cooked properly. Never going to another one

The food was good and came to the table really hot, which was good, and decently priced. However, I've been here 5 or 6 times since it opened and I don't think I've ever had great-or even really good-service and today was no different. Our server seemed really bored, never smiled, had to be asked a couple times to bring things we had asked for (sweet n low and sliced onion-nothing too hard), and did not refill our drinks until asked. She is why I only gave 3 stars.
Love this place and have been going there for years. Their Royal Robin Burgers are the best and the service at this location is always top notch.

We were going for a birthday dinner for my daughter tonight. We were told an hour wait and at an hour and a half I go to ask how much longer.  At that time I'm told it "Will be as long as it takes". So I asked what about outside. I was told we don't have enough servers so you won't get the same service because it's the same servers as inside.  I said ok well if we wait and sit inside how will the service be, Will it be the same as if we sit inside? She tells me no not now. At this point, I'm upset so I talk to the manager. He goes on to tell me that they are working on how they talk to and treat their customers.  That is unacceptable! We wait to be seated then wait another 30 minutes after that to get drinks. At this point half our party leaves because it took so long.  Food came out, of course it was cold. The waitress did the best she could but our party was still split up, food was cold and the service was horrible. My advice to anyone wanting to eat at Red Robin in Brandon Mall - don't! They do not know how to treat paying customers!!!!!! The hostess and manager should be reprimanded!

We went here for my birthday - we had a party of 6 (4 adults 2 kids).  We were told the wait was 35 minutes and was told they would text us.   Over an hour later we received a text, we arrived to the restaurant from the mall within 5 minutes.  They had already given our table away and made us wait an additional 20 minutes (1 hour and 20 minutes total).   We only met here because I have 2 young kids and sit-down restaurants can be challenging at times. Our server was okay.  When we sat down we immediately ordered food.  Server didn't really check on us and the food took forever. Not a great experience.
Expensive burgers, average service, self service check out. Two people eating burgers shouldnt cost $50 but it does.

I went here last night with my husband and one of my sons.  I ordered the guacamole bacon burger and they had the southern charm burger.  My burger was delicious, no complaints, I can't say the same for my husband and son though. They found the burger to be a little too sweet.  I liked the endless fries,  and strawberry lemonade beverage.  We never had to ask for refills on drinks or fries because we had an awesome waitress!  The total was $55 for the three of us (not including tip), which seems a little steep for burgers and fries, but it was a pleasant evening out with family.
The Burgers are always good here and I love the bottomless fries that they give you with the meal. Don't forget to use their signature blend the seasoning on the French fries it's really really good.

Great burger (Bonsai) as always! New garlic and herb fries were on point!  Also love the remodel of this location. New lighting and new glass/wood panels put up to create more private dining experience. Love it.

I had barbecue chicken wrap which was very good and Cole slaw. They sent out chips that were elastic when I let the server and manager know it was taken care of and came out nice and crispy. Oh our server was very good she was multitasking and overlooked the chips but got right on it when made aware of.
last time I came here it sucked. This time it sucked. over priced, sucky service. having to drive to the mall and be surrounded by sucky people. UGH.

Avoid if you like service and sweet potato fries. This was the third time I've been, in a row, that we have had trouble so it is our last. My order isn't difficult--sauteed shroom burger with sweet potato fries. Each time, the first set of fries is cold. They have to be redone. Tonight's were so burned when they arrived we asked for a manager. The burned fries were a big f-you for complaining I think. The manager eventually cooked the third set and brought them to the table. The fries always arrive when I'm done with the burger too. The server was also scarce. I think they don't have enough staff on the floor for good service. They rely too much on the table kiosk. If I wanted fast food and to serve myself I'd go elsewhere. Oh and every time, they still charge me extra for the sweet potato fries. They don't even take it off the bill. We're over it.

My favorite place outside of New England for fish & chips.  Fish always seems fresh, you get 4 pieces with tons of steak fires and tartar sauce for $11,  Give it a try ! Service was excellent and we didn't have to wait too long for a seat on New Year's Day. What I didn't like about it was it came in a basket, fish piled on top of the fries so that the grease (not too much) dripped onto the fries. Yuck.  Also, the basket was small so I had to grab the plate the utensils and napkins came on to eat off of.  Not cool, but it worked. Also their salt shakers were the kind you grind so you got big chunks of salt  on your food,,, and fish and chips need salt..bring back the regular salt shakers please, not a fan. I think a bit expensive. Hubby had a burger, we had a small order of onion rings and 2 cokes and my fish and chips and it was over $40 with tip.  A bit much for lunch!

Wait time was way off, we got a beeper and were told about 30 minutes.  Walked to the other side of the mall and it went off.  Had to immediately walk back before they gave away our table.  Here's where the one star comes in.  Asked if I can get a certain burger medium rare, he said yes.  When it got to the table, it was well done and it's easy to see why.  The burger looked like the hockey puck you get at McDonald's.  You can't cook a burger that thin anything less than well. I asked if they had any burgers that were thicker, so they would come out more rare, and they said no.  Also, the fries were frozen and not fresh.  You would think in a burger place, they would have fresh fries, not here.  Do yourself a favor, save a couple of bucks, walk back inside and get yourself some delicious Five Guys burgers and fries. Red Robin says is it fresh meat, from what I tasted, definitely not.  They tasted like pre-made, frozen McDonald's patties.  Will never go back or recommend to anyone.

This rating is for all Red Robin's we have eaten at around the country including Brandon. We've never had a bad experience at Red Robin and the quality and selection is great. My son loves the Royal Red Robin and I usually get the Burning Love. I've also recently tried the Red Ramen which somehow has a ramen noodle bun. Good burger but tends to disintegrate upon impact due to the bun. Weve enjoyed various other creations here over the years.  Fast and friendly service and worth a stop. IMHO, Red Robin tends to be 3-4 stars depending on the location and server, quality is consistent. Try Burger 21 for (again my opinion) even better burgers such as the Cinco.

This joint was way better then what I remember.  I was here years ago and never came back but was pleased to see that they've expanded their menu and now serve alcohol.  Had a good experience but they're was a funky smell in the place.

Drinks are so-so. Food always impresses. Service has been great both times, but the hostesses clearly need customer service training. One star off for the drinks and hostesses. 4 star food and menu. Prices are reasonable for what you get. If you don't mind sitting outside, you can usually skip the wait. 15 minutes for a table inside, but no wait to sit out on the patio. Patio is nice, tables have table covers on them. Chairs are wrought iron metal, so not comfy for those of us with no natural ass cushions. Seems relatively clean, but not 5-star clean. Lighting on the patio is POOR, so you may need to use your phone to read the menu. However, less light means less bugs when the sun sets, so I'm okay with that. Would be great if they had little reading lamps on outdoor tables.

I must say that I am so disappointed in the service my wife and I recieved at the Red Robin Westfield brandon,  come to think about it  I am in brandon so go figure!!  So 4:30 pm and the manager thinks it's a good idea to send server home and now they are short handed. Unbelievable  I tell you.

Red Robin is one of our favorite burger places. You kinda know what to expect and we are suckers for free birthday meals. The ingredients are always fresh and the unlimited steak  fries are a nice touch. The only complaints I have are that the tomatoes look very poor and tasteless. I do love the vast amount of options of burgers and appreciate the relaxed atmosphere . The servers are always delightful and personable.

Was here to meet a friend, and so was convenient. I had a salad as did not feel in mood for a burger and fries. The salad was fresh and the service impeccable. The only thing is the salad was rather small, and was more expensive than the burger and fries. I don't get it. it was basically just lettuce, some almond slivers and all that. One thing, get the dressing on the side, it was rather sour and tangy and detracted from an otherwise perfect salad. It was good when taken in very small doses. I didn't think about it, and the server did not offer it on the side, and I ended up making a mess as I tried to scrape some of it off of the plate.

Well I have seen the commercials and know the song, so now let me try one of these gourmet burgers, first of all frozen burgers are not gourmet, my burger was dry and over cooked, had brown guacamole and cold bacon and no onions as described. Gross!!! My salad came with the "house vinaigrette" ha ha try Sam's club bulk Italian dressing - more gross. Cramped tiny tables poorly designed, the service was ok but I will definitely skip this overpriced frozen meal and opt for something away from the mall.

I will never go back! My husband went around 830pm. We were sat quickly. That was the only thing that went right! Our drink orders were take by one person and our server was another. We actually were sat around the bar. The bar tender came over and asked if we were ready we asked for a few more minutes. That turned into 15-20 mins! I watched other server play on their phones and hit on each other. Our cheese sticks came out rather quickly but they were under cooked and cold. When they finally came over to take our order we asked to be moved or another server and they wouldn't. They offered us new cheese sticks and to get out food out quickly. However at this point we were sooo past disgusted that we left. While walking out we see the bartender/server out side....really made me wonder how fast out food would came! I will never ever go back!!
Not much for burgers, but the fish sandwich is what's up.  Always busy so we do call ahead seating. Joined the rewards program to earn free food.  Yummy mushrooms  too.. fresh and hand baddered.

My wife and I love burgers, so we went to here for dinner last night. We were seated right away, but waited almost 10 mins before someone came to our table to tell us he would be right back. I got the royal red robin and the wife got a patty melt and during dinner I need a coke refill. Couldn't find our waiter at all after waiting for about 5 mins we asked another person. The burgers were good but like always the steak fries were not that great.  I wish management at red robin would read these reviews. As I watched the service happen I realized it wasn't the person as much as the system around it seemed weird. Remember that how the customer feels at your restaurant is as important as the quality of the food.

Love the food, fair priced plus the reward program has given me many free burgers including several free meals on my birthday. The bartenders are all good, awesome variety of burgers and drinks, my husband and I eat here at least once a month. It's one of our favorite spots for the night I don't wanna cook. Freckled lemonade Is a must try. They have sweet potato and steak fries which are bottomless. If this place closed I would really be sad.

Sat at the bar served by  phoebe or however you may spell it She is very nice let me know she saw me withing minutes of sitting down. I had a gift card  that she had no problem using. Gave me time to look over the menu and then again let me know she would be back to take order within minutes presently surprised at the customer service today ...as previous encounters not so much but let's focus  on the good bar clean service fast.  When I walked in told them the reason for my visit what I wanted accomplished and was directed to the right place just waiting for my boat club now excited at the improved service

Horrible experience. We love Red Robin and have been to several across many states. However, this one was awful. The plates we received our order on looked old and grease stained with the finish having significant wear. My daughter's kid's plate had a dog with sunglasses with human eyes that was so disturbing that she covered its eyes with ketchup.  Now for the food: my regular bottomless fries had a few with cheese and chili on them and the others looked like they were re-gifted. I wondered if they took them off someone else's plate and put them on mine along with a clump of fried something I couldn't identify. My wife's food looked just as bad. It was a horrible looking burger that looked thrown together and like it was taken from someone else's plate. Understand we know what it's supposed to look like based on our great experiences at other Red Robin locations.  Finally, on my way out one very upset family said to me, "Watch out! They have roaches!"  Enough said. Never going back to that location.

#209 What a great way to start 2015, one of my top 3 all-time favorite burgers, The Banzai Burger here at RR. In no particular order, my top 3 burgers are, The Banzai, The Cheesburger Supreme from The Good Steer in Lake Grove, N.Y. and the Cheeseburger served at the Travis Bowling Alley snack bar, Travis AFB, Ca. The Juicy Lucy at Square One is a solid #4 but hasn't cracked the top 3 yet. Recalling my younger days when the 5 hour flight to Waikiki was a weekend trip for airline employees based on the west coast, slammin down what were called Teriburgers was all we needed. Served at all the beachside snack shops the teriyaki burgers were heavenly with that slice of grilled pineapple in there. I just had one and I want another. Red Robin's Banzai is remarkably close. With it you get endless fries which are of the steak cut variety. This time the fries were a bit undercooked but I didn't care, not when a Banzai is sitting next to them.  I know it sounds weird, pineapple in a burger but then ham and pineapple pizza is awesome. Tired of that same old burger? Get on over to RR and put down a Banzai, wake up those taste buds. RR, yum.

I have been a fan of Red Robin pretty much since I first tried it when they opened this location. My husband and I have been several times and USED to always get excellent service. We went about a week ago on a date night and waited at the door for over 5 minutes before someone even approached us to seat us. The restaurant was dead, with maybe 4 tables occupied. We only stayed because we were really craving the (super amazing) food.  The person who finally greeted us did apologize for the wait, which was a plus. However, after we were seated it was a good 5 more minutes before our order was taken, and after that we didn't see any servers until our food came out and then when we got the check (close to 10 minutes after we had finished eating, and without asking if there was anything else we needed). Just horrible, especially for such a slow night. Tonight we went back with our kids. We were seated right away, and while more tables were occupied it still wasn't too terribly busy. We were seated at the booth right between the kitchen and the computer where the waiters total their orders. Several employees walked past and didn't acknowledge our existence. We sat there for close to 10 minutes without being even so much as told it would just be a minute before we called it and walked out. Unacceptable. It's a shame, because we're on a low carb diet and nothing quite hit the spot like a double patty burger and salad from Red Robin, but we won't be back thanks to how badly the service has plummeted.

Been here a few times - and it feels like they've finally hit their stride.   When it first opened, this RR location was pretty slow.  The food is always good - can't go wrong with the burgers, and I'm a steak fry fiend - but the hostess stand was slow, service was poor, and wait times were long.  But now, everything seems to go much smoother.  Good burgers, reasonable prices, and friendly people.   Apparently you can go on a tour of the kitchen too if you ask.  Seems interesting.  Crayons for the kiddo, too!  So everyone is appeased.  The only thing I'd change is the orientation of the hostess stand.  It's set up so the hostess has her back to the main entrance - people were sneaking up on the poor girl all the time.

I don't want to bad mouth this place because a lot of people rave about it, so I'm just going to say it was probably just one "meh" experience. The burger wasn't memorable for me, and the way they served the bottomless fries were kind of annoying. I don't know about you but I'm going to need more than 10 fries at a time, I understand they're thick cut and all but come on. I would appreciate it coming it bigger portions. I definitely will be back just so I can have the great experience everyone else did.

This Red Robin is located inside a mall and, as such, faces challenges a stand-alone location would not. For example, large groups of teenagers popping in to use the restrooms--and thoroughly trashing them--without making any purchases. They are also quite busy on the weekends, especially during the Thanksgiving-to-Christmas shopping period. Despite those challenges, this location manages to provide a very pleasurable experience with regard to both the food and atmosphere. I have been seated very quickly on most of my visits, except a couple of times during the aforementioned period when the mall itself is crowded beyond belief. The waitstaff has been unfailingly attentive, stopping by to check on my table every ten minutes or so to top up drinks and fries or to offer dessert. The dining room has been clean every time I've visited--I'm not going to ding them for the exterior areas, as those are rightly the mall's responsibility--and, yes, the bathrooms can get visibly dirtier than one would see in a stand-alone establishment but, again, this is a mall location that has to deal with mall traffic and I think they maintain reasonable standards given their situation. The dining room can get noisy during busy periods, prohibiting conversation at your table, so if you're the sort of person who enjoys socializing at the table, stick to weekday evenings and lunchtime. The food is above-average for burgers. I would like the burger patties themselves to be better seasoned, as they tend to not have much flavor by themselves, but the menu offers sufficient varieties of toppings to offset that minor flaw. While I appreciate the "bottemless" fries and the variety of sauces for them beyond your basic ketchup, I do find them to be a bit floury-tasting and dry. I'd much rather they be skillet fried given their thickness, or else have the more common thin-cut fries if Red Robin insists on deep-frying them. Most of the desserts are tasty, and I especially enjoy the doughnut towers, but they are also a bit pricey for the amount your receive. A tip for those who find the prices here a bit on the high side: join the Red Robin Royalty club and you'll receive coupons every six weeks or so in your email. As an example, last week Royalty members received 15% their total meal purchase once a day for an entire week. That really helps keep some money in your wallet, and I've not received any junk mail from signing up.

Came here last night for date night and was told it'd be a 20-30 minute wait.  Not too bad, and it only turned out to be like 10 or 15.  Our server Lindsey was very polite and attentive.  Our appetizer didn't get entered into the system, but all parties (server, manager, runner) were very nice and apologetic and it was taken off of our bill when it came out with our burgers. Girlfriend had the Whiskey River Burger and enjoyed it, I went with the Burnin' Love and it was a formidable opponent for my spice-loving taste buds.  I love that you can get whatever kind of bun you want - my BL was awesome on a ciabatta roll.   All in all, I was a Red Robin fan before and still am after last night's experience.  The only problem is that I'm still looking for a parking spot at the Brandon mall...

I think I would have been better off hitting up a drive through in the area.  I'm sure I would have had a better experience.  First off, when we arrived, the hostess was missing for at least 10 minutes.  When we were finally seated, the booth was filthy.  Imagine the floor of a Chuck E Cheese after several birthday parties.  We had to ask for a napkin to wipe down the seats.  The order computer thing on the table is pretty cool, but it felt like they imported grime and grease to make it extra sticky.  I know I can't wait to get my hands nice and filthy before I eat a burger.  The waitress was loud, which probably helps when the restaurant is loud, but she was more drill sergeant loud than nice waitress loud.   It took well over 30 minutes for our food to come out.  We were on the funky order computer trying to see if we could cancel our order when the waitress tried to speed things up. As for the food, the burger was good, but wasn't better than what you would expect from a place with gourmet in the title or from a table service burger restaurant.  We ordered the fruffles, as part of the two for 15 deal.  Unfortunately, they weren't fully thawed.  I get that most of these places have pre-made frozen deserts.  I don't mind.  I do expect them to thaw them out fully.  My fruffles had the cold sweats.  Maybe they spun them around and around and gave them motion sickness.  I think the cold sweats were due to a crappy thaw.  I wrapped them up in my napkin (I was too scared to ask the waitress for a box) and brought them home to fully thaw.  They were pretty good once you got them to room temp.  As a nice capper, the waitress told us to pay the grease computer.  Ordinarily, I would have been more than excited to use the cool computer.  At least dinner was finally over.

One of the reasons I was avoiding Red Robin when they came to Brandon was my initial impression that they were quite expensive - perhaps from one day years ago when I Googled them and their online menu suggested higher prices? The crazy long waits were also another reason I was staying away, however the other day some friends and I decided to give it a shot. I ordered the classic gourmet burger ($8.99). The burger itself was nothing too impressive. Square 1 Burgers has much better beef quality and seasoning. The ingredients did not taste impressive either and the size of the burger was also quite small. It looked more like a large Whopper from Burger King than a gourmet burger to me. The bottomless steak fries were pretty good. They required some salt/seasoning for the right taste, but with an endless supply - there was certainly enough to go around. The waitress was quick to bring refills on both the fries and our drinks as well. Overall, decent burger...but I prefer Square 1 Burgers if I am in Brandon. The fries were good, but honestly no reason to not head to Cheesecake Factory instead and have some of their burgers instead if you're at the Brandon Mall.

I wish I could give this resteraunt less than a star me and my husband have tried calling for and being on hold for more than twenty minutes when we were able to pick the order the food was cold the fish tasted more of the freezer fish with the burger being soggy I will not recommend to any of my friends and I'll not be coming back anytime soon

I really wanted to give this place a better review, but here is a tip: Don't serve stale bread with a cheeseburger. C'mon, even BK steams their buns? The food was tasty, don't get me wrong, but our experience was lowered by this. Of course, it's a franchise place and we should have known better.

This place gets 5 stars for exactly what it is. This is the best place to get a delicious burger and any kind of drink you can think of. And the fries are bottomless.... here is a neat tip if you are really hungry and want an appetizer just ask for them to bring you some fries while you are looking at the menu. They will be happy to do so. I always get the banzai burger so i cant review anything else. you get your choice of 5 different buns, 4 different types of patties including vegetarian options, you can even have 2 different kinds of chicken instead of beef. don't forget to get a red robin royalties card as you get a free burger on your birthday month and every 9 burgers gets the 10th for free

Worst service ever. I thought I was at Sears. From the extended wait for a table, to the repeated assurances that "I'll be right with you". The general level of grime on everything it was disappointing on every level. Getting a burger and a beer should never be this hard. It's not like they have a hugely diverse menu. Maybe it was a bad afternoon, but no problem... I'll never be back.

Red Robin used to be good years ago. The quality of their food is bad, no where near where it used to be. Don't let the pictures fool you. The food that you will get looks nothing like the pictures on the menu. The service has taken a turn for the worse. This must be because people are no longer going there so all the good waiters are gone.
Decent burgers.  I wouldnt drive out of my way to go here but since it was in a mall it worked for us. The price was a bit high for my liking.

I've been to red robin locals before, I love their menu items and they are a great price. BUT THIS LOCATION SUCKS. Sorry, but it's not true to the menu or other locations. The service was slow, but that did not make up for the fact that their cooks aren't adequately trained or cooking food properly to the standards of Red Robin.

We go to this location frequently because of its location in the mall. I have been reluctant to give a review until now because I'm always hoping that I just came on a busy day and the service really isn't as bad as it seems. Unfortunately, I believe the service gets worse each time we visit. Drinks are never refilled in a timely manner. Fries are not refilled until end of meal. We use the contraption on the table to call our server and order drinks but it seems to take even longer. I feel that with the new set up, we get overlooked. The food is consistently good. We usually order burgers and fries with the occasional salad. We have never been disappointed with the food. The children's menu has a wide variety of selections which helps with a fussy toddler.

Since this location is attached to the mall, it's pretty much always packed, but the wait time is never too long. They have sweet potato fries, which are my favorite (especially because they're bottomless)! Also, I really appreciate how many options they give you for the kid's menu. With that said, the actual burgers are... meh. Not really memorable at all.

We have always had a great experience with this location and love the burgers. We get excellent service most of the time (there have been a few exceptions, but they are few and far between) and the managers always check to see if we need anything else.
Ok it's a Red Robin. Burgers are yum and the  fries are bottomless! Service can be an issue sometimes. For the most part a solid establishment.

We finally made it to the new Red Robin in Brandon Mall. We knew there would be a wait with it being the newest happenin' place open right now, so we got there earlier around 5pm and walked around the mall until our table was ready - 30 minutes later we got a text saying the table was up! The reservations were even made on an iPad, ah technology! Hubs enjoyed catching up on football in the waiting area with TVs on the floor. I've only been a few times, when I visited family up north, but I was so excited for Red Robin to open up by us. With affordable meals and bottomless fries, it was the perfect post-long run day eatery! Food: I got the Shrooms burger with a side of broccoli Hubby had the Original Tavern burger, since he was a newbie to the whole experience. Verdict: We loved it! Great food at a great price! The hostess was very nice and we felt a bit rushed by the server but I kind of blew that off since it was opening weekend and all. We'll definitely be back!

The food was really good, the server on the other hand was not. She kept getting our order wrong and another disappointing thing was that they no longer give military discounts. Probably will not be coming here anymore

Tasty burgers!   I got the prime chophouse burger which is a grilled burger with provolone,  dijon mustard,  crispy onions strings,  and mushrooms (its normally horseradish shrooms,  but i requested plain).  It was excellent!   It also comes with a huge onion ring on top.  It was fried perfectly crispy.   The price is a little high,  but you get unlimited fries (or broccoli)  so it's not a bad deal at all.   Only bad thing was the massive hit of thirst.  After checking out their website afterwards, the burger and fries came out to 2051 mg of salt, no wonder!   Went during lunch on a Thursday, about a 2 minute wait.  Very good service.   Will go again!

Having food allergies, I'm nervous dining out places because of some bad experiences. I'd rather a place say that they don't have anything I can eat than to have an allergen menu and then disregard it. So when I heard enough people with allergies talk about Red Robin, I reluctantly gave it a try... and I'm so glad I did! It was Father's Day and the restaurant was busy, but not so busy that we didn't get seated immediately. I liked that the booth was high so that I wasn't back-to-back with the next person. In fact, my 3 year old stood up and wasn't tall enough to look over it (always a plus). When they gave us menus, I was nervous when they said they didn't have an allergen menu and that I would have to go on my smartphone to look up the items that comply with my dietary requirements. I thought I was screwed. Luckily, there was a very extensive menu of items I could choose from and all of them seemed reasonably priced. We ordered the Baja Dip and Chips, two burgers, garlic fries, fruit salad and a lemonade for my husband. I was surprised that the burgers came with bottomless sides. Initially, I had ordered a gluten-free bun, but right before my order came out, they let me know they ran out and I had a manager personally come to my table and make it up to me by giving me a voucher for my next visit. They didn't have to go the extra mile, but they did, and for a first time visitor, that made all the difference in the world! I ended up having my burger on a lettuce wrap. I was satisfied with it, as I'm used to ordering just a burger in lettuce at other burger places. It was very juicy, especially with the leftover baja sauce I put on it from the appetizer. My husband had a bacon guac burger that he raved over. The garlic fries were amazing and the freckled fruit salad was addicting. My husband wasn't overly fond of the lemonade, but I don't blame the restaurant, as everyone's tastes are different. Finally, I don't know what was better- the food or the service. Our server, Amber Dawn, was simply amazing. She was helpful in having us navigate how Red Robin works, including their rewards club, ordering and paying (whoa, technology!), extremely knowledgable about the menu and explaining how seriously they take allergy orders, and just super friendly overall. All of our food was brought to us within a reasonable amount of time (and believe me, with a 3 year old, we notice every minute!), and the drinks were always refiled promptly. Though I didn't catch the woman's name, there was also a runner who brought us food who was friendly and cheerful.  For less than $30 (not including tip), my husband, my 3 year old and I were completely stuffed, satisfied and eager to return. Thanks Red Robin; yum!

I really like the bonsai burger. I ordered it medium rare and it came medium. I'm not sure if that's just a thing with them; that everything is actually medium. But regardless, if you want a medium rare burger, You may have to actually stress medium rare. The fries are fantastic, and endless. It was a great lunch.

I walked in around 1. Was asked if I need a seat in the bar or away from it. I asked for one away from the bar and I was told I will have to wait for 15-20 minutes. I could see a lot of others waiting too.. When I had walked in, I saw a lot of free tables on the outside and I asked to be seated out.. It was not very cold outside and I am sure that many of those who were waiting would have opted for it if asked. I also wasn't offered it until I specifically asked for it. The service speed was okay. Had to wait for the second helping of the bottomless fries.. they were worth the wait.. But nothing much to talk about the burger. The bun was slight burnt while toasting.It didn't affect the taste much. The patty was not that great in my opinion. The waitress was very attentive and check on me often.

Had the best evening with my hubby the other night! There was a bit of a wait (it was a Saturday night) so we decided to have a couple drinks at the bar. The bartender, Ricky, was fast and very friendly. He made my husband (the martini snob) a great martini and recommended a delicious drink for me as well. We were sat not far from the bar so that we could still watch the football games. Our server, Rikki (different from the bartender!) was the best! She was very friendly and recommended us some of the best burgers we have tasted. She kept our drinks full and provided some awesome conversation. We will definitely be back and will request her section again. Thanks for a great date night!

Really yummy burgers and decent service. We had to wait a bit, but they take your name and info and text you when your table is ready.  We had the fried zucchini sticks and mozzarella sticks appetizer, and the zucchini pieces were way too big. Mozzarella sticks were a huge hit. They forgot hubby's beer long enough that he got frustrated, then our dinners came almost at the same time as our apps.  Whiskey river burger was super good, and hubby enjoyed his as well. A+ in the taste department, they do burgers right.  Kid friendly and a balloon for my toddler on the way out.
Totally screwed our order up! And have been sick at my stomach for 2 days after eating there. Bartender broke a whole bottle of wine and blew it off as a f### up! Not a good experience!

I finally got to have my first Red Robin experience at this location on a recent lunch.  I was impressed with the Menu and all of the various choices.  I decided to try the new Smoke and Pepper Burger which was one of their featured items on my visit.  I was pretty impressed with it and thought it had a good balance of toppings and flavors.  As far as the endless fries, those left more to be desired.  I didn't really see the appeal, but to each his own.  Not a bad spot to stop in if you're in the mood for a burger and don't just want the regular variation, although you can find them here as well.

Great service, unspectacular food. That really sums it up. For all the hype I have found on separate visits, the quality, freshness and taste of the food at Red Robin do not hold true to their famous "Yum" commercials.

Good food as always. Burger and fries. Fries are always really good. The service was extremely friendly here at this one. Changing my 4 stars to 1. Within 20 min of eating here I was not feeling well and had some major cramps.

It was a pretty good burger. I got a special Smoke & Pepper burger, but I think I would have been happier with the A1, which would've have fried onion strings. And the bottomless fries are good, don't forget to ask for refills on them. But with all the burger competition in the area it was hard to rate them a 5. Try Square 1 right around the corner for some amazing burgers with exotic meats.
Good food, good service. Not bad At the mall. Drinks are pretty good too. Prices are ok

So the wife and I are checking out places we haven't been to in a while, and tonight after voting it was Red Robin. Great service although towards the end I felt rushed, especially for a Tuesday night. Having ordered the classic cheeseburger I recalled why it's been so long since we've been here. Just an average burger, although I love the fries, I wish we'd gone to Five Guys.

Tasty burgers and fries in a typical mall American food establishment. Red Robin is an excellent value for families. We always share a burger (try the barbecue chicken) and get plenty to eat because of the bottomless fries.
Great fast service. Food was wonderful. So many burgers to choose from.  Unlike the one across town the food came correctly and hot to the table.

I usually wouldn't jump to visit a chain restaurant like this but when family consensus is overwhelmingly for it, I had no choice. Against all hesitation and weariness, I was however pleasantly surprised. We were celebrating grandma's birthday. It was a party of five. Grandma and I shared the crispy cod fish sandwich, which was soft and delicate and just the right amount of crispy. Mom enjoyed a large chicken salad  (she wished the chicken had not been cold). Brother got the burger which he swears by. The Bad My grandma and I both ordered the clam chowder. Each of our orders tasted and looked like completely different soups. One was watery, lacking clams and light in color. The other was thick, full of clams, yet incredibly salty. Something was up. We asked the waitress who said one of us got a fresh batch and the other got the ends of the last batch. She did everything in her power to rectify the issue - It was a problem from the kitchen, so we didn't blame her. She brought us a new bowl and even the manager came over to apologize. This was nice of her. The Good When the manager learned that it was my grandmother's birthday, she asked if she could bring a dessert. We asked if they had anything sugar free (as grandma is diabetic), but they did not have anything. Later, we were told the manager searched the mall looking for a sugar free dessert for her. This was really sweet and unexpected. Although she couldn't find her anything sans sugar, she brought a complimentary dessert for the table anyway and still had the servers gather round to sing Happy Birthday. Grandma was happy. She got balloons :) The customer service here makes up for any lacking in the kitchen. The burger and the fish sandwich was also worth it. One of the best perks is that there is unlimited fries with certain sandwiches/ burgers so that should fill you up. 3.5

I am an avid fan of Red Robin, but the new Brandon location might still be working out some kinks. We arrived and were told that there would be a 30 minute wait, but could receive a text whenever our table was ready allowing us to go peruse the mall. This was a nice feature! We were seated next to a table with multiple children that were making a huge mess all over the floor and tables. When the table left no one came over to clean up the mess so we were left to sit next to it throughout our meal until right before we left. About 5 minutes went by before a server came to get our drinks. Both of us had waters. We placed our order with our drink order. 20 minutes later someone - not our server- came out to ask us if we had ordered (what we did) and then ran back to the kitchen. After 40 minutes had passed our meals came out. I was tempted to send mine back. I had ordered the grilled chicken sandwich. My entire sandwich was cold. The buns had basically disintegrated after sitting for so long and from water/juice . I asked for an extra plate and ate just the chicken on the plate and sent the rest of the slop back. They offered to replace my sandwich but we weren't ready to wait any longer. The bf enjoyed his burger, but it was almost cold when it came out. The fries were tasty and fresh and were the best part of the meal. The manager came over to apologize and comp'd my meal noting that it was not up to standard. I will visit again in hopes that one of my favorite burger spots will earn itself another star!

Yummy yummy yummy. The red tavern double makes my mouth water. I crave it all the time. I also love the endless fries and I get ranch to dip them in. And their mint chocolate brownie shake is awesome. I love this restaurant better than the one in North Tampa. Great for kids. Fun atmosphere. And service was great. Don't forget to sign up for your Red Robin card so you can get a free burger for your birthday.

Love this place, had to drop in for a quick lunch for the first time a while since our last visit...small portion of fries but of code you can order more unlimited...but my bacon burger, Awesomesauce!!

Just had lunch here. The food was good, got seated right away. We ordered the smoke and pepper burger, ghost tavern burger, onion rings, chili cheese fries and a cup of chili. Food was good and came out pretty quick. Paid, got home and realized I never got my cup of chili! Called the reataurant and I did not feel satisfied with the result. Don't know when I will be back but this experience definitely  put a damper on my view of Red Robin.

This review is called Natasha Saves Dinner. Our group of 6 ate at Red Robin Sunday evening, December 9; we arrived before 5 and gave the host our names and were told that when our seating was ready, we'd be sent a text message on the cellphone number we provided.  That didn't happen--when we asked about our seat and gave our party's name, we were told that that party had just been seated.  Uh oh.  Despite this, we were given a table pretty soon after that, so we felt things were looking up; we then hit another bump in the road. We sat at our table for 15 minutes, and no one came to see us. We tried a few times to catch someone's attention, but it wasn't until we stopped Natasha, a server walking by our table, that things really began to look up.  She hadn't even clocked in to work yet, but stopped everything else she was doing, apologized for our wait, and took our entire order.  After that point, she went above and beyond to ensure every question was answered and each need we had was met.  She was awesome, and any restaurant would be lucky to have her. Our food was really good; if you've not been to Red Robin before, order the Royal Red Robin burger, their signature sandwich.  It's a nicely done bacon cheeseburger with the tasty addition of a fried egg in the mix; couple that with their bottomless french fries and you'll need to wheel yourself out of the restaurant.  I also really enjoyed the salted caramel milkshake. This was my second visit to the Brandon mall location; the first occured a couple of weeks earlier, and the service and food were really good.  I was just motivated by the excellence and follow-through of our server Natasha to write this review.  The food's good, Red Robin--if you have more wait staff like her, then the service is outstanding (and please fine-tune your seating process, kthanx).

Our wait was a solid 20 minutes, which wasn't too bad for the weekend. First off, both my burger and my daughter's came out wrong. I was missing bacon and she was missing cheese. On a good note, the manager comped both of our meals without us even asking. As far as taste, The burger was at best, average. There was not a lot of flavor and it tasted like it had been previously frozen. Next, my wife's fries, although bottomless, were very scant. The floors were so slippery and felt like I was working in a greasy kitchen as I made my way to the restroom. My youngest ordered a pasta meal and when we got the bill realized she had been charged for a large pasta. It would've been nice for the server to ask us which size we'd prefer. Overall, the lunch was not very satisfying other than the adjusted price. We may be back but not anytime too soon.

My first experience with RR was in Eatontown NJ and since then , its usually been a good experience.  My 2 favorites would be the Burnin' Love or the Banzai , Quality is usually very consistent with a few exceptions.  The burgers are as bountiful as the bottomless fries and unlimited refills.  The options they give you to customize the burger however you want it are nearly endless, I like the idea of giving you bun options, it something other places should implement as well. Service unfortunately varies a lot, but considering this is a new location and the bugs haven't been fully worked out, they did a good job at the high traffic location.

excellent service and food! BOTTOMLESS FRIES!!!! such a great place to take your family. The only downfall was the wait, but it is my fault to think it would be slower on a Sunday. Went on Tuesday at the off peak time and service is faster. Had server Andrew good looking guy and fast server. extremely attentive!

Burgers ordered "burnin love" and bacon burger. I had a grilled California chicken on a bum.  Kiddos enjoyed the huge burgers and I cannot complain about how appetizing my chicken was. Drinks lemonade and ice tea. Bottomless fries say it all and the price wasn't bad either. I think more of a family joint and the service was fantastic! Not quite a 5 star but hey, there's always room for improvement. Worst thing about the place-parking. That mall is ridiculous.

Build your own burger......my kind of restaurant. I visited with a few friends on a weekday. I was surprise to see Sponge Bob and other cartoons on TV. I guess it is safe to assume that it's geared towards kids. I was very pleased and impressed with our server who remember all of the orders (even the complicated ones) and was very good at suggesting burgers to fit everyone's taste without having to do the whole build your own which could be more costly. I love that you can get a lettuce wrapped burger instead of the bun. I'm not a big burger fan but Red Robin has my vote.

My husband and I had hoped to eat at this restaurant today, but never got seated.  We were told there would be at least a 20 minute wait when we gave our name to the hostess and were willing to wait that long.  I had previously eaten at this location with my daughter and was raving about the food to my husband.  When we realized that   20 plus minutes had passed, my husband went to the hostess stand to inquire how much longer we needed to wait before our name was called.  He was told that our name had already been called and since we did not respond, we were taken off the list.  Every other restaurant we've been to calls names at least twice before taking names off of the list and we did not hear our first call.  We were not sitting that far from the hostess stand, so should have been able to hear it.  She told him that we would be the next 2 called so we wouldn't have to wait any longer.  Two couples were called before us and when I said something to the hostess that we been told we would be next, she said they were waiting for these tables.  We left feeling very disappointed that we were not able to enjoy the burgers and fries that your restaurant is famous for.  By the way, we did note that the bus staff was moving very slowly and commented to each other that one young man was looking very tired as he was slowly cleaning off a table.

I ordered a simple burger "pink center" and I ended up with an over cooked, dry hockey puck.  The coleslaw wasn't that great either.  The server was very nice however.  There was nothing special about this place that would ever bring me back.  It's way over - priced and the food is not good.
Childhood favorite from Seattle, so my review is probably biased. Bottomless fries and rootbeer floats.... what more do you need to know.. Go!

I went here with my 2 kids and my hubby once. It was a terrible first time. We ordered the salted caramel shake which was to die for. We all got a different burgers which we all thought were mediocre. The worst part though was our service. I asked our waitress for water on 3 separate occasions and she didn't bring it to me until she brought our check. Epic fail. She also did not bus our table so we had multiple dirty plates just sitting around. I asked to speak to the manager and he gave us a free shake with our next purchase of a meal. Needless to say we will not be using that or going there again despite their very delicious milkshakes.

Solid 4-star on this one The only thing that keeps it dragging full marks is the service. I know they're new on their feet, but I worked at a RR in Michigan, I know their corporate training program and I honestly believe the three people who have served me since I've been should have been more on top of their game. Other things to note: save your time/money and pass on the beer here. With Brass Tap just across the way you definitely don't need to waste the cash on the mediocre selection at Red Robin. Pluses? Great vegan options, fantastic menu, and BOTTOMLESS FRIES.  Need to hear that again (because I certainly can't say it enough)? BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES WITH DELICIOUS RED ROBIN SPICE BLEND. Dude, EAT ALL THE FRIES.  Anyway, one of my favorite hang outs and you know with one this close to my house I'll be in all of the time. Hope to see you there!

Excellent burgers, cooked to perfection! Nice selection of items on the menu plus the ability to customize. Fast and friendly service. We also liked the Yukon chips with onion dip appetizer. Price was reasonable for the quality.

I don't know how a place can specialize in "gourmet" burgers, yet can't cook a burger medium.  They may ask you if you'd like it pink or no pink, but it's always well done.  If you want a good burger go to Grillsmith.  It's right there in the mall, the burger is 10oz angus beef.  It's the best in town.

Kind of disappointed with this location.  Lunch on a Thursday before noon had a wait of 20 minutes.  There were plenty of tables inside and outside that were open.  According to the hostess they are understaffed.  The food doesn't seem to be the same as other Red Robins I have been to up north either, specifically the onion straws here are soggy not crispy and chicken seemed a bit slimy.
Pretzel bites were amazing!  I had the Bonzai burger for the first time and it was good, just a little sloppy though. Halfway through it just fell to pieces.

I know everyone has had those times where they go out and wish that they had ordered something else...so goes my Red Robin experience.   This Brandon location looked to be completely swamped; however, after leaving my phone number at the hostess station, I received a text saying that our table was ready within minutes.  The atmosphere is what I would expect from a burger place; kind of family sports bar-ish.  I am not sure that I expected a full bar, but it was definitely appreciated!  This location has AWESOME domestic draft prices, and a decent drink menu.  With regards to their well known burgers, I was going to order something quite simple off of the regular menu, but I opted for the premium Smoke & Pepper burger.  It is a half pound Angus burger on ciabatta bread, with black pepper bacon, sharp cheddar, and a house made Smoke & Pepper ketchup.  The burger was decent enough, but I just think I would have enjoyed something else more.  I think I would have liked the burger more, had it not been prepared well done, as opposed to the medium well that I asked for.  Also, I could have lived the rest of my life without the tang of that Smoke & Pepper Ketchup.  It was...I guess tart would be the word.  It was extremely overpowering.  The plus side is that they do serve it on the side.  The endless fries though, were awesome, and well seasoned.

Our waiter, John was awesome. He was very busy on the Sunday night we chose to visit but he handled things like a pro.  He was very friendly, very professional, and very attentive especially considering how busy it was.  I ordered the select Black and Blue burger. Was very messy. The burger itself was delicious in spite of falling apart and dripping all over and I added very little of the garlic sauce they give you on the side. I ordered the sweet potato and have to say I was very disappointed. They were basically old and cold when I got them. I did not complain so cant give feedback on how this would have been handled. Daughter, husband and grand daughter enjoyed their meals very much. We ordered the chips and queso and tho the queso was yummy they only give u about a dozen chips. The chips are fresh and good but need to give more. We had to ask for more chips. When You go, you MUST order the tower of rings. Yum!!!  You get about 10 onions rings in a tower that are crispy and fresh with 2 different dipping sauces. Hubby order the bacon cheese burger and made himself finish because it was so good. Kids meal was good size for toddlers/ younger kids. Plenty of food. Staff was quick to refill drinks and bring anything we needed. Definitely will visit again.
